title: U.S. stock futures advance after losing stretch
text:
* Futures on the Dow Jones Industrial Average YM00 rose 273 points, or 0.8%, to 33161.

* Futures on the S&P 500 ES00 gained 45.5 points, or 1.1%, to 4153.

* Futures on the Nasdaq 100 NQ00increased 185.5 points, or 1.5%, to 12737.

On Friday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA fell 349 points, or 1.05%, to 32900, the S&P 500 SPX declined 68 points, or 1.63%, to 4109, and the Nasdaq Composite COMP dropped 304 points, or 2.47%, to 12013. Friday's drop dragged the S&P 500 down 1.2% for the week.

What's driving markets

Analysts are assessing whether stocks have dropped enough given the Fed's desire to stamp out inflation by lifting interest rates. Key inflation data is set for release on Friday.

"They'd need some clear evidence that inflation is slowing down before they would consider slowing the pace of rate hikes. That keeps the focus squarely on the CPI," said Marshall Gittler, head of investment research at BDSwiss Holding.

"When the economy looks strong – market worries shift to inflation and the risk of higher interest rates. When the data are weaker – the opposite happens. The result? Volatility," added analysts at RockCreek, a Washington, D.C. investment firm.

Markets also were paying attention to signs the White House is loosening its stance on tariffs. U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said household goods and bicycles "may make sense" as products to ease levies. Solar companies including SunRun RUN rose after The Wall Street Journal reported there won't be any new tariffs on solar imports for two years.

The largest U.S. company by market capitalization, Apple AAPL, will be in the spotlight as it's holding a developers conference in which it's expected to unveil new products.

U.S. stock futures advance after losing stretch
